comments.content: your typo here, should be storage vMotion

discussion.content:
For linked Clone is Rebalance, and Manual Desktop is vMotion!!

This reference:
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/57368
This is manual desktop not Automated Desktop. Rebalance is for automated desktop pool..
Agreed with Ankoji. The correct answer is B - Storage vMotion.

comments.content: B - Storage vMotion. The pool is not automated.

discussion.content: Storage vMotion is just NOT DONE, re balance is the correct answer

questions.question_text:
One of the datastores containing a manual desktop pool is running out of disk space and an administrator adds a second datastore.
Which operation should the administrator perform to resolve the issue?
When an existing AppStack is updated, which two actions must be performed? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The AppStack is provisioned to a virtual machine
choices.C: A VMFS snapshot of the existing AppStack is made
choices.D: The existing AppStack is cloned to a new .vmdk

questions.question_text: Writable Volumes can be assigned to which three choices? (Choose three.)

While investigating slow performance, an administrator discovered that none of the desktops in the Microsoft Windows desktop pool is reporting metrics to vRealize Operations for VMware Horizon.
What action would enable the Microsoft Windows desktop pool to report metrics to vRealize Operations Manager for Horizon?

choices.B: Enable vRealize Operations Manager for Horizon in the Microsoft Windows desktop pool settings in the View Administrator console
choices.C: Add the vRealize Operations Manager for Horizon security tag to the Microsoft Windows desktop pool virtual machines
choices.A: Verify that the Microsoft Windows desktop pool has been included in the vRealize Operations for Horizon Broker Agent configuration
choices.D: Add the users of the Microsoft Windows desktop pool to the vRealize Operations Manager Everyone group

discussion.content:
From the link https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vRealize-Operations-for-Horizon/6.6/com.vmware.vrealize.horizon.install/GUID-93EB11F9-2873-41D3-8749-EDA4277EA7BC.html
"Procedure
1. If the Broker Agent Config Utility for Horizon wizard is not already open, select Start > VMware > vRealize Operations for Horizon Broker Agent Settings.
...
5. On the Event DB and Desktop Pools page, configure your event database and desktop pool settings.
In the Event Database Information section, enter your event database credentials and click Test.
(Optional) In the Desktop Pools section, select the Specify Desktop Pools check box, select whether to include or exclude the specified pools, and enter desktop pool IDs (separated by commas) in the text box."

comments.content: Its 100% as above the answer is A i just run through the Horizon Broker Agent Settings and its there as described.

I think the answer is ok, because from the link of JoeTromundo say: (Optional) In the Desktop Pools section, select the Specify Desktop Pools check box, select whether to include or exclude the specified pools, and enter desktop pool IDs (separated by commas) in the text box.

discussion.content: You must configure the broker agent to collect events from the event database and send them to the Horizon Adapter

It should not be B?
"A" refers to the action to verify the root cause of the problem, but B shows the way to solve it.

questions.question_text: Which type of virtual machines can an existing pool contain when cloning an Automated Desktop Pool from an existing pool?

comments.content: Ok, but for this test, we have to consider the old version. C is correct (LINKED CLONES)

the latest horizon 7, able to duplicate/clone instant clones also
see https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/virtual-desktops/GUID-387EF5EB-95DC-46ED-8EBB-3646FD987647.html

discussion.content: You can clone automated desktop pools that contain full virtual machines or View Composer linked clones. You cannot clone automated desktop pools of instant clones, manual desktop pools, or RDS desktop pools.
